Topic.Title: Why President O used Greek Columns

Message.Msg: Since when did architecture become a representation of freedom? Why not practice it versus stand back and admire it? Obama's strain of freedom envisions a people in total dependence on the government for their entire sustenance. The power, the money and the source of all good comes from the government in his world. If you need it the government will provide it, unless of course they have decided that you don't need it. That is not freedom and I don't care how many columns a building has in its facade. The pretense that we all need to worry about is the ideology of this man that wants more time to do more harm to the American way of life and many more of our basic freedoms. You keep your columns; I would prefer to be free. You and many of the other liberals on this board and those that fell for this trap when voting are far too much into symbolism versus reality. You really are empty chairs.

Topic.Title: First Family Looking at Life After

Message.Msg: President Barack Obama is partly blaming his family and children for his inability to lessen Washington’s partisanship and gridlock during his first term. On CNN’s “State of the Union” Sunday show, Jessica Yellin said she interviewed Obama for a forthcoming documentary and asked him why he did not do more outreach to Republicans in the beginning of his term to bridge the divides Obama often rails against. Yellin said Obama told her one of the reasons he did not was because he wanted to spend more time at home with his kids and family. "He was trying to spend some time at home with his family in the evenings and on the weekends,” Yellin said. He does indeed think family comes first, especially his family.

Topic.Title: Ask yourself - Are you better off now...

Message.Msg: Yep, things are better. The lying about jobs continues unabated. U.S. Added 96,000 Jobs in August; Unemployment Rate Fell to 8.1% The economy added 96,000 jobs in August, well below expectations, adding pressure on Federal Reserve policy makers, who have hinted they will act to stimulate the economy when they meet next week. However, the jobless rate fell to 8.1 percent, from 8.3 percent in July, an indication that more unemployed workers were discouraged about the propsects of finding new jobs.

Topic.Title: GOP , Not Sounding Off Lies ToDay

Message.Msg: The basic platform differences; If you ever wondered which side of the fence you sit on, this is a great test! If a Republican doesn't like guns, he doesn't buy one. If a Democrat doesn't like guns, he wants all guns outlawed. If a Republican is a vegetarian, he doesn't eat meat. If a Democrat is a vegetarian, he wants all meat products banned for everyone. If a Republican is homosexual, he quietly leads his life. If a Democrat is homosexual, he demands legislated respect. If a Republican is down-and-out, he thinks about how to better his situation. A Democrat wonders who is going to take care of him. If a Republican doesn't like a talk show host, he switches channels. Democrats demand that those they don't like be shut down. If a Republican is a non-believer, he doesn't go to church. A Democrat non-believer wants any mention of God and religion silenced. If a Republican decides he needs health care, he goes about shopping for it, or may choose a job that provides it. A Democrat demands that the rest of us pay for his. If a Republican reads this, he'll forward it so his friends can have a good laugh. A Democrat will delete it because he's "offended".

Topic.Title: Demoncrats are hypocrites

Message.Msg: "The people who don’t pay federal income taxes are, as the phrase goes, “rational economic actors” just as much as anyone. Like all people, non-taxpayers respond to economic incentives. Their demand for entitlements and government programs is naturally insatiable because they don’t care at all about the cost. Non-taxpayers don’t have any “skin in the game” and are completely indifferent to the government raising income taxes. So they will always support increasing government programs as a long as they get even a small benefit from them because it does not cost them a cent. It’s also perfectly rational for non-taxpayers to support politicians who favor more spending. Non-taxpayers get something for nothing, at least until the country becomes insolvent." More of the Democratic platform...their version of keep them barefoot and pregnant. If you give them enough they will never desert you. Like the old adage, if you give a man a fish, he will soon be hungry again, if you teach him to fish, he will never go hungry again. If you teach a good Democrat to fish, he will just sit in his government furnished boat and drink beer all day. Those getting something for nothing will NEVER vote against the guys giving them their non-earned goodies. The Democrats fully understand this; it is their mantra, their defense against all their other nonsensical rhetoric.

Topic.Title: Will the Man from Hope, restore our Faith?

Message.Msg: The Man from Hope should have been in jail years ago. He is nothing more than a lecherous old con man. I know Easy will scream about his balanced budgets, etc., without a hint of the fact that he had a Republican Congress for most of his time in office. Obama scares the BeJesus out of me, but old fools like Harry, Nancy, Biden (don’t forget he has a real chance to become President) and other old Democrats in Congress are the real threat to our economy and life as we know it. In their minds the word compromise means, ‘you do it our way’.

Topic.Title: Why President O used Greek Columns

Message.Msg: Since when did architecture become a representation of freedom? Since Pericles' funeral oration, 460 BC. "For heroes have the whole earth for their tomb; and in lands far from their own, where the column with its epitaph declares it, there is enshrined in every breast a record unwritten with no tablet to preserve it, except that of the heart. These take as your model and, judging happiness to be the fruit of freedom and freedom of valour, never decline the dangers of war." It's worth reading the whole oration. You'll find many of our American values in it: fordham.edu/halsall/ancient/pericles-funeralspeech.asp

Topic.Title: Demoncrats are hypocrites

Message.Msg: "I propose all entertainers and wealthy demoncrats give up half their net worth to support their constituents! If they want to give other people's money away they should provide leadership!" Then vote for Obama. Romney wants to give these people ANOTHER giant tax cut. What don't you understand about this? If you want wealthy "entertainers and democrats" to pay their fair share, vote for the party who also wants them to pay their fair share--democrats. If you think these people deserve another giant tax cut, vote for Romney. "we are accustomed to the idea that high income earners pay more in taxes both in absolute terms and as a percentage of their incomes." #$%$-We all know these people pay a much lower percentage of their income in taxes than the rest of us. Just look at Romney & Obama, what they've paid--around 15%.

Topic.Title: Ask yourself - Are you better off now...

Message.Msg: I am much butter off now than then. The Veteran's Administration is now a friendly, helpful place to go. They have more offices closer to where you live, and treat you like a real person. I voted for Obama the first time. One reason was McCain was to busy in Arizona when a major VA bill came up for a vote. He always wanting to put troops here and their, but many now believe true help begins at home. This is what we need to do, fix our infastructure, so our people, and businesses can thrive once again. We need to vote out those who are unwilling to comprimise. When go to Washington and set on their hands, we need to boot them out. They act like a bullies, and I hate to say I think they are slightly racist. We need to get the Country back from the Hate group that has take the GOP off to right, and into the ditch. Back to better off. My 401 is getting back to normal, and in some cases far above areas of loss. I bet on America when there was blood in the streets. Having lost thousand on a stock that tumbled from poor leadership, and then 9/11. I did not give in I purchased m uch of this stock as it plumeted. Today this stock is a leader, and pays a very heealth dividend. Romney tells us what he will do. Yet, he knows the best time to look good is take over when thing are the worst. He knows our economy will come back regardless. What he want is to appoint to the Courts, and preserve the tax cuts for the rich.

Topic.Title: Fraudulent birth certificate or hidden tax returns?

Message.Msg: “I suggested to the Romney campaign that they should offer five years of tax returns in exchange for a DNA test of Obama to determine who his REAL father is. So far, they have not used my suggestion.” – wilkes And this just in; the response from the Romney campaign staff: Dear Mr. Wilkes, We are in receipt of your recent message that you left stapled to the dog house on the roof of Mr. Romney’s Lamborghini. Unfortunately, much like the research and homework you put into your plan, sadly the dog ate most of it. With the tattered remaining remnants, we are able to ascertain that you’re making, essentially, two suggestions. First you want us to obtain some DNA samples from the President to try to support your conspiracy theory that Frank Marshall Davis is actually Mr. Obama’s father. We must confess, while most of our claims are indeed a bit wacky, yours is certifiable, outright lunacy. Forgetting that for a moment, good luck getting some DNA from a sitting President to support idiotic nutballs like yourself – and even if you could, Mr. Davis has been dead for almost a quarter century. I know you are available to take time off from your cubicle job to perform an exhumation, and would believe that you probably would even do it under the cover of darkness like Jerry Cruncher in the Tale of Two Cities. Or, perhaps you could luck into a date with one of his 4 daughters, and clandestinely obtain a hair sample, like Newman. We find your DNA suggestion to be something that only some kind of crazy, maniacal screwball would suggest. Having said that, the DNA suggestion pales in comparison to your next suggestion, which is further from reality. Release 5 years of Mr. Romney’s tax returns?????? Have you come completely unhinged? Now that’s really nutso. Don’t you think that if we could have done that and had any chance at being elected, we would have already done it? Get back to reality, man. Whose side are you on, anyway? Respectfully, The Romney Campaign Staff

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes...
Message.Msg: ...“A man said to the Universe, 'Sir, I exist!' 'However,' replied the Universe, ‘ the fact has not created in me a sense of obligation’.” - Stephen Crane I’m not certain doing this without music is any longer worth doing. “True wisdom is less presuming than folly. The wise man doubteth often, and changeth his mind; the fool is obstinate, and doubteth not; he knoweth all things but his own ignorance.” – Akhenaton "Congratulations to Mitt Romney on his purchase of the Republican presidential nomination.” – Jay Leno “The illusion which exalts us is dearer to us than ten thousand truths.” – Aleksandr Pushkin “Live out your imagination, not your history.” – Stephen Covey “Life is a zoo in a jungle.” – Peter Vries “Bill Clinton will be at the Democratic convention. Say what you will, but Clinton is still polling very well. I tell you, sometimes these jokes just write themselves." –David Letterman “I have come to believe that a great teacher is a great artist and that there are as few as there are any other great artists. It might even be the greatest of the arts since the medium is the human mind and spirit.” – John Steinbeck “Over and over again, we must stress that a healthy ecology is the basis for a healthy economy.” – Claudine Schneider “Clint Eastwood came out at the Republican convention and did ten minutes of wingnut improv. It was kind of a metaphor for the entire Republican party -- a confused old person yelling at something that doesn’t' exist." - Bill Maher “The English instinctively admire any man who has no talent and is modest about it.” – James Agate “Let us think the unthinkable, let us do the undoable, let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all.” – Douglas Adams “Much like the Republicans, the Democrats are going to have a mystery speaker. I believe it’s Mitt Romney’s dog.” – Jay Leno “A fact is like a sack which won’t stand up if it’s empty. In order that it may stand up, one has to put into it the reason and sentiment which caused it to exist.” – Luigi Pirandello

Message.Title: AHQ (cont.)...
Message.Msg: ... “It doesn't matter if you try and try and try again, and fail. It does matter if you try and fail, and fail to try again. “ – Charles F. Kettering “There will be a rain dance Friday night, weather permitting.” – George Carlin "If Mitt Romney looks familiar it's because for 18 years on All My Children he played Palmer Courtland." –David Letterman “Perhaps the imagination is on the verge of recovering its rights.” – Andre Breton “Men for the sake of making a living, forget to live.” – Margaret Fuller "I’m very excited; we have Ron Paul on the show tonight. Unlike the Republicans, we're actually going to let him speak” - Jay Leno “Let every student of nature take this as his rule, that whatever the mind seizes upon with particular satisfaction is to be held in suspicion. “ – Sir Francis Bacon “The Enlightened take things Lightly.” – Principia Discordia "If your party can run the nation for eight years, and then have a national convention and not invite Bush, Cheney, Rumsfeld, Colin Powell, Karl Rove or Tom DeLay, you’re not a political movement. You’re the witness protection program." –Bill Maher “The doctor sees all the weakness of mankind; the lawyer all the wickedness, the theologian all the stupidity.” – Arthur Schopenhauer “I wish I would have a real tragic love affair and get so bummed out that I'd just quit my job and become a bum for a few years, because I was thinking about doing that anyway." - Jack Handy "Outside it's like 82 and cloudy – like Clint Eastwood." – David Letterman “In living through this ‘great epoch,’ it is difficult to reconcile oneself to the fact that one belongs to that mad, degenerate species that boasts of its free will. How I wish that somewhere there existed an island for those who are wise and of good will! In such a place even I should be an ardent patriot!” – Albert Einstein, 1914

Message.Title: AHQ (final)...
Message.Msg: ... “Apathy can only be spread by those who do not bother to do anything about it.” – anonymous “As an adolescent I aspired to lasting fame, I craved factual certainty, and I thirsted for a meaningful vision of human life—so I became a scientist. This is like becoming an archbishop so you can meet girls. “ – Matt Cartmill "Tonight is the last night, the final night of the Republican convention. Tonight is the swimsuit competition." – Conan O’Brien “Dare to be naïve!” – R. Buckminster Fuller “Aphorism’s are literature’s hand luggage. Light and compact they fit easily into the overhead compartment of your brain and contain everything you need to get through a rough day at the office or a dark night of the soul.” – James Geary, Aphorist "There are reports that nine of the hotels being used for politicians at the Democratic National Convention have bedbugs. When asked what it’s like to have to deal with thousands of ruthless bloodsuckers, the bedbugs were like, 'Eh, it’s OK’.” - Jimmy Fallon “A religion old or new, that stressed the magnificence of the universe as revealed by modern science, might be able to draw forth reserves of reverence and awe hardly tapped by the conventional faiths. Sooner or later such a religion will emerge.” – Carl Sagan “Any random group of thirty Vietnamese women will contain a dozen who make Julia Roberts look like Lyle Lovett.” – P.J. O’Rourke "Mitt had to follow Eastwood. He's a little stiff. He makes Al Gore look like James Brown at the Apollo. And for five minutes the crowd was chanting, 'Bring back the chair’!” - Bill Maher “I have found you an argument; but I am not obliged to find you an understanding.” – Samuel Johnson “The Republican Convention ended on Thursday. The Democratic Convention began last night. In between was a travel day for #$%$" – David Letterman “The wines that one best remembers are not necessarily the finest that one has ever tasted, and the highest quality may fail to delight so much as some far more humble beverage drunk in more favorable surroundings.” – H. Warner Allen (from the wine list of Commander's Palace in New Orleans) “Have a good weekend, all.” – echo2165 “The leading idea which is present in all our geological researches, and which accompanies every fresh observation, the sound of which to the ear of the student of Nature seems echoed from every part of her works, is—Time!—Time!—Time! “ – George Julius Poulette Scrope
